data.text: Rear View Mirror for Touring Bicycle

I’m looking for a rear view mirror that works well to see oncoming traffic behind me as I’m riding. What has worked for you? I was using a helmet mirror but they’re annoying and have to be constantly adjusted, a hazard in itself.
Safe Zone, ordered online, is my very favorite. Attaches with zip ties so very easy to move from one helmet to another.

data.text: I use a helmet mirror designed by a local cyclist in Dallas. It is removable and holds onto the helmet mount with a strong magnet. The shaft is made from a spoke. Once you adjust it to point where you want, it stays put. I've been using their 1st generation of this design for about 10 years and they recently started selling this update. Here's their FB page, which has a link to their website. https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=100083077557131

This helmet mirror: https://www.etsy.com/listing/656743727/helmet-rear-view-mirror-bike-helmet?click_key=a3a5123f6e728c64d1181951da4b0a3c3168518f%3A656743727&click_sum=173c62b6&ga_order=most_relevant&ga_search_type=all&ga_view_type=gallery&ga_search_query=beer+view+mirror&ref=sr_gallery-1-4&sts=1 Once you set it, it remains in place unless you whack it against something. I recommend setting it in a parking lot or on a low-traffic, low-velocity street: it takes some time (and more strength than you'd think), since you bend the spoke for it rather than the mirror being on an hinge.
